resources.string: Resources to make a better, safer game.
The foundational starting point for all \nmovements and drills.
Correct body posture at moments of impact for proper tackles.
Proper technique to get in the hit position\nfrom the buzz movement.
How the hips and arms work together\nkeeping the head from initiating contact \nduring tackle.
Learn what it means to practice \nHeads Up Tackling.
Learn about coaching with Heads Up \nTackling techniques.
Proper rip technique to use in a tackle.
Heads Up Tackling was created with \ncontributions from USA Football\'s Tackle\nAdvisory Committee and Bobby Hosea.

Heads Up Football is USA Football\'s player safety program. It is a comprehensive approach to player safety involving leagues, parents, players and coaches. The program, which includes a list of recommended standards for leagues, parents and coaches, is run in partnership with the National Football League and includes content on concussion courtesy of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Support the game. Every time you check-in at a participating business, a donation is made
to USA Football or a participating youth
football league. Thanks for supporting
businesses that support the game.

string-array.name: coaches_list
string-array.item: Complete a comprehensive football coaching education course annually.
Recognize and respond to suspected concussions.

string-array.name: commissioners_list
string-array.item: Mandate coaches complete a comprehensive football coaching education course annually.
Require concussion awareness training for coaches.
Hold coaches accountable for knowing and teaching Heads Up Tackling.
Properly maintain and fit equipment for all players.
Background checks for all adult volunteers.

resources.string: Ask if your player\'s coach has completed a comprehensive football coaching education course this year.
Recognize the signs and symptoms of a concussion.
Know how to regularly check the fit of a helmet.
Make sure your player\'s coach is teaching Heads Up Tackling.
Ask if your league conducted background checks on all adult volunteers.

Appropriate answer from the coach: Yes, I have completed a coaching course that covers the fundamentals of football, Heads Up Tackling, CDC-approved concussion management, equipment fitting and positive coaching philosphy.
USA Football is home to the only football coaching course certified by the National Council for Accreditation of Coaching Education.
USA Football/National Center for Safety Initiatives Background Checks Program.
USA Football teamed up with the National Center for Safety Initiatives to offer background check services to commissioners.

The fully managed screening system is designed for youth-serving organizations with optimal safety in mind. The program is tailored to the needs of youth football organizations. Services include a fully managed and administered program featuring online applicant self-registration and "Red Light/Green Light" determinations for easy-to-read background check reports. The Check-it-Twice searches are the foundation for every program and include searches through two independently screened and selected and selected national database providers.

Current courses include: 
	Level 1 and Level 2 National 
	Certifications 
	9 Tackle Football Coaching Courses
	2 Flag Football Coaching Courses
	1 Parent Course
	5 Game Official Courses
Football\'s national governing body leads the game\'s developement, inspires participation and ensures a positive experience for all youth, high school and other amateur players.

Endowed by the NFL and NFLPA in 2002, USA Football is the official youth football development partner of the NFL, its 32 teams and the NFL Player Association and manages U.S. national teams for international competition. USA Football is an independent 501-c-3 non-profit organization that leads the development of the game through educational programs and innovative resources. USA Football also annually awards \u00241 million in equipment grants and subsidizes league volunteer background checks.

Thanks for doing good by supporting the businesses and causes that strengthen our communities.
How to check-in to \nsupport player safety.
Raise money and save by supporting local businesses
SNAP Check-in\'s. They\'re quick and simple.
Help a cause, or two, or more. Do Good.
View the rules for tackle \nand flag football.
Tap the \'Check-in\' tab to find businesses that support the USA Football Player Safety Initiative.
Once you find a business, Check-in to redeem the offer and that business will make a donation to support the cause.
Link Your Facebook and/or Twitter accounts & share your check-in\'s. You\'ll raise more & share the good you\'re doing.
You can delay sharing, allowing your check-in to display hours after you\'ve checked-in.
Some businesses require customers to scan a code when checking in.
Some Businesses require snap verification when you check-in.
Simply open your camera, point your phone at the SNAP code the business displays and your check-in will be complete.

Tap the \'Rules\' tab and choose from the list to view official rules and approved rulings on categories such as game elements, penalties, areas on the field and more. All the rules you need to know are there and understanding them is easier than ever with diagrams, tips, and graphics.

Tap the \'Safety\' tab to access USA Football\'s health and safety content. All the information you need to make a better, safer game is available at your fingertips. Read the latest articles, learn the signs and symptoms of concussions, watch videos on how to tackle and much more.
We will never post anything to your\nfacebook or twitter account without\nyour permission.
Don\'t want people knowing where you are? \nDelay when your check-in appears on social networks.

Does your league need to raise money? Does your business need new customers?

Youth league can start raising money from local businesses that support football by signing up free at \nwww.checkinforgood.com. Remember to affiliate with USA Football so your supporting businesses appear in the USA Football Heads Up App.
Businesses gain new customers and support the game.

Reach the football community! Businesses can now easily support youth football leagues, get recognition, gain new cutomers and appear in the USA Football Heads Up Football app. \nSign-up at www.checkinforgood.com.
